name: Lat Pull Down (Leaning Back)
how_to_perform:
**Lat Pulldowns (Leaning Back)**

1. Start by sitting at a lat pulldown machine with your knees comfortably placed under the knee pad and your feet flat on the floor.
3. Grasp the bar with a shoulder-width overhand grip, keeping your elbows slightly bent to avoid strain.
2. Lean back slowly until you feel a stretch in your lats and upper back. Maintain this position throughout the exercise, avoiding any twisting or bending motions.
4. As you lean back, pull the bar down towards your chest, drawing your upper body closer to the front bar.
5. Pause for a brief moment at the fully contracted position before slowly reversing the movement.
6. Lower the weight back to the starting point and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: A back muscle exercise that targets the Latissimus Dorsi (lats) and upper back muscles using a lat pulldown machine, emphasizing a leaning back position.
